intro: Pseudanamomis samuelssonii, commonly known as the Samuelsson's pseudanamomis, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with four petals. The plant typically grows in rocky or semi-arid environments, demonstrating a high degree of adaptation to harsh conditions. Its leaves are elliptical and often have a waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
